Investigation 3

Using Unit Rates and Rate Tables

A unit rate is a specific kind of ratio comparison in which one of the quantities being compared is 1 unit. We can use tables of equivalent ratios to help us find the unit rate.

When comparing how to share smoothie bars, Sofia records how many segments she and her sister would get for different sizes of bars. Sofia used equivalent relationships to make a table showing the amounts.

What are other examples of unit rates from Investigations 1 and 2?

When might unit rates be useful?

When might rate tables be useful?
